headline.main: FRANCE'S DEBT SEEN ALMOST AT A TRILLION; Bank of France Sets 47,300,000 Francs Aside for Dividend

lead_paragraph: PARIS, March 28 (delayed via Berlin) -- At the first general meeting of the board of directors of the Bank of France since the military collapse in June, 1940, Governor Briart de Boisanger made known that 47,300,000 francs were set aside for the 1940 net dividend, which amounted to 233.60 francs each for the foreign held shares and 262.40 for the French owned ones.
abstract: Estimate on natl debt; Bank of France repts on aid to Govt, 1940
